intro: Sonchus diffusa, commonly known as common sowthistle, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features alternate, heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces yellow flowers with ray florets, followed by spiky, bristly fruits that are dispersed by wind. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Botanically, it is characterized by its milky sap and is part of the Asteraceae family.
